Use Arbor to analyze your data

There are two main ways to use Arbor.

Arbor apps

If you want to run a common comparative analysis in a simple and clean way using a web interface, you can use Arbor apps. Arbor apps are websites that can run analyses - like ancestral state reconstruction and PGLS - using a straightforward drag and drop interface.

Arbor workflows

If you want to build a workflow for your analysis, you can use Arbor workflows. We current have three Arbor instances running on Amazon cloud that are free for you to use.

Arbor AWS instances

You can also download and install your own Arbor instance using Vagrant.

Updated March 01, 2016
